meanings.definition: To put an end to; halt or stop.
meanings.sent1: She kiboshed the noisy argument by calmly explaining the situation.
meanings.sent2: The teacher kiboshed the students' plan to skip class by assigning a surprise quiz.
meanings.sent3: The cat kiboshed the peaceful atmosphere by knocking over a vase.
meanings.sent4: The storm kiboshed our beach plans for the day.
meanings.sent5: The referee kiboshed the game due to unsafe playing conditions.

meanings.sent1: The kiboshed cake was burnt and inedible.
meanings.sent2: The kiboshed surprise party was a total disaster.
meanings.sent3: The kiboshed picnic was rained out, but we still had fun indoors.
meanings.sent4: The kiboshed vacation plans left us disappointed but determined to make the best of it.
meanings.sent5: The kiboshed movie night was salvaged by ordering pizza instead.

meanings.sent1: The kiboshed team accepted their loss with grace and sportsmanship.
meanings.sent2: The kiboshed candidate congratulated their opponent on the well-deserved win.
meanings.sent3: The kiboshed chess player laughed off their defeat and challenged their friend to a rematch.
meanings.sent4: The kiboshed project taught us valuable lessons on resilience and perseverance.
meanings.sent5: The kiboshed plan to climb the mountain motivated us to train harder for the next attempt.
